name: concentrated solar power plant construction, solar tower power plant, 20 MW | concentrated solar power plant, solar tower, 20 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21965/documentation

This activity represents the construction of a concentrated solar power solar tower plant with a capacity of 20 MW in Upington, South Africa.  The construction of the solar power plant requires five different units in order to produce electricity. The five key units are collector field area, receiver system, thermal storage unit, steam generation system and a power block unit. Further, site preparation activities are also included in the dataset  (e.g. clearing shrubs, construction of roads, fences, providing water connectivity).;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany.

The activity starts with the preparation of the site (land use, access roads, buildings, water supply,  clearing shrubs, construction of roads, fences, etc.)

The activity ends with the power plant ready for electricity production after combination of all necessary components and and all necessary preparations.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 20 MW solar tower power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from a dataset modelled for the location Upington, South Africa. The original data modelling a 440 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 20 MW plant design. Uncertainty has not been adjusted as it is assumed that the modelled 20 MW solar tower power plant would be very similar in other parts of the world.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 20 MW solar tower power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.
